thread.title: Alphabet’s Stock Expected to Rise After 3Q15 Release
thread.title_full: Alphabet’s Stock Expected to Rise After 3Q15 Release

title: Alphabet’s Stock Expected to Rise After 3Q15 Release
text:
Alphabet’s Stock Expected to Rise After 3Q15 Release By Matilda James 17 minutes ago  
( Continued from Prior Part ) Analysts positive for Alphabet’s stock 
Alphabet (GOOG) will release its third quarter earnings for 2015 on October 22. As discussed in the first part of the series, analysts expect strong results from the technology giant in the third quarter. Aside from projecting strong numbers for both earnings per share and revenue, analysts from Credit Suisse expect Alphabet’s share price to rise to $815 after the release of its 3Q15 earnings. Reasons for high projection 
Some of the reasons for such a projection for Alphabet’s stock by analysts include the rise in the number of paid clicks by 18% year-over-year in 2Q15, as well as the continued rise in Alphabet’s core products, including YouTube. YouTube exhibited a 60% rise in viewing hours on a year-over-year basis. Google’s stock movement after 2Q15 
Google’s (GOOG) stock rose by 20% after the release of its 2Q15 earnings. Ruth Porat debuted as Google’s first female CFO in 2Q15 and took the lead as she addressed investors during Google’s second quarter earnings call. 
Analysts speculated that the move was an effort to restore investors’ confidence. Google’s shares fell 9% on the S&P 500 Index in the last 12 months through June 2015. In comparison, competitors Facebook (FB), Amazon (AMZN), and Apple (AAPL) reported share price rises of 32%, 32%, and 26%, respectively. 
To get diversified exposure to Google, you can invest in the PowerShares QQQ ETF, Series 1 (QQQ). The ETF invests about 3.7% of its holdings in Google.
